title: WHO WE ARE — Dr. Borman & Associates Chiropractic & Naturopathic Medicine
sitename: Dr. Borman & Associates Chiropractic & Naturopathic Medicine
cleaned_text: ROBERT BORMAN, DC Robert graduated from Colorado State University in 1974 and then graduated cum laude from the National College of Chiropractic in 1978. Since that time he has been practicing in Denver, developing and honing our unique non-thrusting mobilization technique focused on correction of spinal related nerve, muscle, and joint problems. He was on the board of directors of the Colorado Chiropractic Association from 1994-2001, and served as president in 2000. In 1999 he served on the Colorado Workers Compensation Chronic Pain Task Force. When Robert is not in the clinic you might find him hiking outside of Boulder and Lyons, skiing in Vail or Beaver Creek or kayaking and rafting the Colorado river. WILLIAM BORMAN, DC Bill attended the University of Colorado as an undergraduate before enrolling at the National College of Chiropractic where he received his Bachelor of Science degree in Human Biology in 1988. He then graduated summa cum laude with his Doctorate of Chiropractic degree from National College of Chiropractic in 1990 and has been practicing our unique form of gentle chiropractic ever since. Outside of the office Bill enjoys swimming, hiking and biking. He also enjoys western dancing with his wife Bonnie, a 3rd generation Chiropractor. DANE BORMAN, DC, DACBR Dane graduated from Colorado State University with a Bachelors degree in Biological Science in 2000. In 2004 he was the class valedictorian from Western States Chiropractic College. In 2008, he completed his residency program and was awarded the Diplomate of the American Chiropractic Board of Radiology. He is currently a faculty member at Community College of Denver and was the official team chiropractor for the 2010 World Champion Rocky Mountain Roller Girls. When Dane is not around the clinic he enjoys riding his motorcycle, working in the garden and running or attending Zumba classes. Dane also enjoys rafting and snowboarding. Rachel Walker, ND, LMT Rachel completed her undergraduate education at Colorado College and received her doctorate in Naturopathic Medicine from Bastyr University in Washington. Dr. Walker is a member of the Colorado Association of Naturopathic Doctors and the American Association of Naturopathic Physicians. Rachel specializes in integrative care and patient advocacy. Having worked in athletic training, wilderness emergency medicine, and massage therapy, she draws inspiration from a variety of disciplines. Her approach to naturopathic medicine is evidence-based but open minded. As a former college athlete, Rachel enjoys recreational team sports. She is an avid runner and amateur horticulturist.
